1. The Histogram Module¶

class kea.hist.BPASS_hist¶

A container for the BPASS data to reside and make it possible to perform basic operations on the enclosed data.

The internal bining is linear, because it allows for easier comparison to other data. But logarithmic binning can be plotted and requested.

Fill(x, w=1, ty=None)¶

Add data to the BPASS plot.

ty is “log” or “lin”. If none is given, log is assumed.

getLinBins()¶
return the middle point of the bin in linspace. Except for the first bin,

which runs from 0 to 10**6.05,but return 10**6.

getLinEdges()¶

returns the bin edges in linear space

getLogBins()¶

returns the middle point of the bin. Except for the first bin, which runs from 0 to 10**6.05, but return 6.

getLogEdges()¶

Returns the bin edges in log space

integral(x1, x2)¶

Performs the integration between the values and corrects for the binning being in Gyr instead of yrs.

plotLin(*argv, **kwargs)¶

Plot the data on a linear scale.

plotLog(*argv, **kwargs)¶

Plot the dat in a logarithmic way

class kea.hist.histogram(xlow=None, xup=None, nr_bins=None, edges=None)¶

A class to make a simple histogram and fill it with data. It creates a histogram based on a lower and upper limit and a number of bins within those limits.

The lowest bin and the highest bin are used to catch overflow or underflow values! Make sure your histogram covers your whole space. The upper edges are non inclusive.

Fill(x, w=1)¶

Add data to the histogram. x is the x-axis position. If no weight is given 1 is used.

getBin(x)¶

Get the bin number of the data value

getBinContent(bin_nr)¶

Return the value of the given bin

getBinWidth(i)¶

return the bin width of the given bin

getNBins()¶

Return the number of bins in the histogram

getValues()¶

Return all the values

integral(x1, x2)¶

Perform a binwise integration between x1 and x2.

plot(*argv, **kwargs)¶

Plot the histogram

sum(x1, x2)¶

Perform a binwise summation of the values in between the given values
